metadata.title: CVE-2015-7519 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
agent/Core/Controller/SendRequest.cpp in Phusion Passenger before 4.0.60and 5.0.x before 5.0.22, when used in Apache integration mode or instandalone mode without a filtering proxy, allows remote attackers to spoofheaders passed to applications by using an _ (underscore) character insteadof a - (dash) character in an HTTP header, as demonstrated by an X_Userheader.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7519` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-passenger - 5.0.22-1
passenger - 5.0.22-1
ruby-passenger - 5.0.22-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: passenger package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.22-1').
